content.description: Sit start back of the roof matching hands on a jug, make one move to a tiny seam above you and set up for a big move out onto the face. From this obvious jug/hole traverse the lip out left through some positive holds, then move vertically through a couple of crimps to the top.
content.location: This roof and problem is roughly 50 ft right of Unknown Cliff-3. Keep following the broken cliff down and you'll run into this roof.

content.description:
Start on the horizontal under the roof, make one big move to a jug out on the face, then a little big move to the lip up right and the mantle top out. 

  Super fun problem, just short.
content.location: This roof and problem is roughly 150 ft right of Unknown Cliff-1 and 2. From the "courtyard" where the Unknown Boulders are you will skirt the cliff around a few corners then you'll come upon this roof. You'll see a "Dangler" (Gunks route) style horizontal crack just above the lip of the South face of this roof.

content.description: Stand start on the arete, using features on both faces take the arete to its top, traverse to Unknown Cliff-1's top out through the tiny roof.
content.location: Arete just right of Unknown Cliff-1

content.description:
Stand start with hands on the vagina looking feature, move up through nice crimps then make one pretty freakin big move to the lip/horizontal. Make one move to the lip of the small roof then mantle it out.  

  The dyno and top out are exciting for sure!
content.protection: Pad(s). I don't think one pad would do much if you didn't stick the dyno or above.
content.location: Along the wall across from Unknown Boulder A and specifically problem Unknown A-2, far right when facing the wall. This problem is roughly 30 ft from Unknown Boulder A.

content.description: The mini-cliff offers a few nice, fun roofs along with some highballs. Varied stone ranging from amazing to junk and everything in between. Problems can be found up and down the cliff.
